com.opportunity.ui

Class OpportunityUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opportunity.ui.OpportunityUI

  • public class OpportunityUI
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that models one Opportunity Game UI. Students would be making use of this to generate the UI and control the Opportunity Game itself.
    Author:
    Ryan Dimaunahan and Lance Alcabasa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OpportunityUI(java.lang.String title)
      Constructor that instantiates the Opportunity Game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OpportunityUI

        public OpportunityUI(java.lang.String title)
        Constructor that instantiates the Opportunity Game. This constructor also sets the look and feel of the interface to the CrossPlatformLookAndFeel look and feel of Java.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the game by displaying the UI.

      • getBca

        public BlowUpClickAction getBca()

      • setDeckCardCountOfPlayer

        public void setDeckCardCountOfPlayer(int deckCardCount,
                            int playerNumber)
        Sets the card count displayed on the deck button on the screen, however, this does not actually change the number of cards in the deck, it merely alters the display. Call this method whenever you change the card count of the actual Deck in your implementation so that the value displayed on the deck button on the screen would match the actual card count.
        Parameters:
        deckCardCount - is the new cardCount.
        playerNumber - is the player number of the player whose deck count you want to change (1 or 2).

      • getDeckOfPlayer

        public javax.swing.JButton getDeckOfPlayer(int playerNumber)
        Gets the deck button on the game screen of a player. Use this method if you want to assign Click Actions to the deck of a particular player. See ClickAction to know more about this.
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - is the player number of the player whose deck you want to get (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        the deck button of the player
        See Also:
        ClickAction

      • appendTextToTextLog

        public void appendTextToTextLog(java.lang.String newText)

        This method appends text to the Game Log. The Game Log serves as an action history; every time a player makes an action it must be logged in the Game Log. You may follow the sample shown below:

        GAME START

        IT'S PLAYER 1'S TURN!
        Player 1 invests in opportunity!
        Player 1 draws a card from the deck.
        Player 1 invests in opportunity! Double Opportunity!
        Player 2 draws a card from the deck.
        Player 1 ends the turn!

        IT'S PLAYER 1'S TURN!
        ...

        Remember that you may use \n to display a new line in the Game Log.

        Parameters:
        newText - additional text to append to the end of the Game Log.

      • setDiscardCardCountOfPlayer

        public void setDiscardCardCountOfPlayer(int discardCardCount,
                               int playerNumber)
        Sets the card count displayed on the discard pile on the screen, however, this does not actually change the number of cards in the discard pile, it merely alters the display. Call this method whenever you change the card count of the actual Discard Pile in your implementation so that the value displayed on the discard pile on the screen would match the actual card count.
        Parameters:
        discardCardCount - is the new cardCount.
        playerNumber - is the player number of the player whose deck count you want to change (1 or 2).

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the deck button of the player
        See Also:

      • addClickAction

        Adds a Click Action to the Opportunity UI.
        Parameters:
        clickAction - the click action you want to add to the Opportunity UI.
        See Also:
        ClickAction

      • getCardImageLoader

        public CardImageLoader getCardImageLoader()

        Gets the Card Image Loader helper defined in the OpportunityUI. Use this in combination with the other helper methods of the OpportunityUI to modify the cards being shown in the card labels of the UI.

        For example, in an OpportunityClickAction subclass, you may use the following code to alter the card image currently loaded in the Blow Up Card label:

        this.getOpportunityUI().getBlowupCard().setImage(this.getOpportunityUI().getCardImageLoader().getLargeImageIconFor(CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL0));

        Note that the getLargeImageIconFor() method was used because the blow up card label requires a large sized image. For the investments and prime investments labels, use getMediumImageIconFor() instead.

        Returns:
        the CardImageLoader that is automatically created along with the OpportunityUI
        See Also:
        ClickAction, CardImageLoader, Card

      • getBtnEndTurn

        public Button getBtnEndTurn()
        Gets the "End the Turn" button. Use this to assign a click action to the "End the Turn" button.

      • getBlowupCard

        public Card getBlowupCard()
        Gets the label that displays the Card Blow Up. Use this method to change the image in the Card Blow Up label, or if you want to assign Click Actions to the Card Blow Up. See the CardImageLoader class for more information on how to load card image and the ClickAction class for more information on how to create Click Actions.
        Returns:
        the Card Blow Up label
        See Also:
        ClickAction, CardImageLoader

      • getInvestmentsOfPlayer

        public Card[] getInvestmentsOfPlayer(int player)
        Gets all five investment cards of a player, given the player number, as an array of cards. You may use array indexing to get the specific investment card that you need. Remember that array indexing starts at 0. Use this method to change the image in that particular investment card or to assign Click Actions to a specific investment card. See the CardImageLoader class for more information on how to load card images and the ClickAction class for more information on how to create Click Actions.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player number of the player whose investment cards you want to get (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        an array of cards corresponding to the investment cards of the selected player.
        See Also:
        ClickAction, CardImageLoader

      • getInvestmentCardOfPlayer

        public Card getInvestmentCardOfPlayer(int player,
                             int investmentCardNumber)
        Gets a specific investment card on the board, given the player number and an investment card number. The investment card number must be a value from 0 to 4, if another value is given, this method would throw IndexOutOfBoundsException. Use this method to change the image in that particular investment card or to assign Click Actions to a specific investment card. See the CardImageLoader class for more information on how to load card images and the ClickAction class for more information on how to create Click Actions.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player number of the player whose investment card you want to get (1 or 2).
        investmentCardNumber - is the card number of the investment card you want to get.
        Returns:
        the card label that corresponds to one investment card in the game board.
        See Also:
        ClickAction, CardImageLoader

      • getPrimeInvestmentCardOfPlayer

        public Card getPrimeInvestmentCardOfPlayer(int player)
        Gets the prime investment card of a player, given the player number. Use this method if you want to change the card image on that particular prime investment card or to assign Click Actions to a prime investment card. See the CardImageLoader class for more information on how to load card images and the ClickAction class for more information on how to create Click Actions.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player number of the player whose prime investment card you want to get (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        the prime investment card of that player.
        See Also:
        ClickAction, CardImageLoader

      • setCardImageOfInvestmentCard

        public void setCardImageOfInvestmentCard(int playernumber,
                                int investmentCardNumber,
                                int image)
        This is a helper method that sets the image on a particular investment card. Use the constants defined in the CardImageLoader to select which image to load. This method does the same thing as getting the Investment Card first using the getInvestmentCardOfPlayer() method then setting its image by calling the setImage() method passing a relevant method call of the CardImageLoader of the OpporunityUI. Basically, this method is here to make your job easier.
        Parameters:
        playernumber - is the player number of the player whose investment card you want to get (1 or 2).
        investmentCardNumber - is the number of the card that specifies which card to get from the player
        image - is the image you want to load. Use the constants defined in CardImageLoader to select which image to load.
        See Also:
        CardImageLoader

      • removeCardImageOfInvestmentCard

        public void removeCardImageOfInvestmentCard(int playernumber,
                                   int investmentCardNumber)
        This helper method removes the image on a particular investment card. This method also automatically empties the investment card.
        Parameters:
        playernumber - is the player number of the player whose investment card you want to get (1 or 2).
        investmentCardNumber - is the card number of the investment card you want to empty.

      • getCardImageOfInvestmentCard

        public int getCardImageOfInvestmentCard(int playernumber,
                               int investmentCardNumber)
        This is a helper method that gets the card image of a particular investment card of a player. This method will return one of the constant values defined in the CardImageLoader class; to use this method, you might want to check if the value returned by this card is equal to one of those constants, then react from there. For example: if (this.getOpportunityUI().getCardImageOfInvestmentCard(1, 0) == CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL0) { this.getOpportunityUI().setCardImageOfInvestmentCard(1, 0, CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL1); }
        Parameters:
        playernumber - is the player number of the player whose investment card you want to get (1 or 2).
        investmentCardNumber - is the card number of the investment card you want to get the image of.
        Returns:
        the card image as a constant defined in the CardImageLoader class.

      • setCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard

        public void setCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard(int playernumber,
                                     int image)
        This is a helper method that sets the image on a prime investment card. Use the constants defined in the CardImageLoader to select which image to load. This method does the same thing as getting the Prime Investment Card first using the getPrimeInvestmentCardOfPlayer() method then setting its image by calling the setImage() method passing a relevant method call of the CardImageLoader of the OpporunityUI. Basically, this method is here to make your job easier.
        Parameters:
        playernumber - is the player number of the player whose prime investment card you want to set the image of (1 or 2).
        image - is the image you want to load. Use the constants defined in CardImageLoader to select which image to load.
        See Also:
        CardImageLoader

      • removeCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard

        public void removeCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard(int playernumber)
        This helper method removes the image on a prime investment card. This method also automatically empties the prime investment card.
        Parameters:
        playernumber - is the player number of the player whose prime investment card you want to empty (1 or 2).

      • getCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard

        public int getCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard(int playernumber)
        This is a helper method that gets the card image of a prime investment card of a player. This method will return one of the constant values defined in the CardImageLoader class; to use this method, you might want to check if the value returned by this card is equal to one of those constants, then react from there. For example: if (this.getOpportunityUI().getCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard(1) == CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL0) { this.getOpportunityUI().setCardImageOfPrimeInvestmentCard(1, CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL1); }
        Parameters:
        playernumber - is the player number of the player whose investment card you want to get the image of (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        the card image as a constant defined in the CardImageLoader class.

      • setCardImageOfBlowUpCard

        public void setCardImageOfBlowUpCard(int image)
        This is a helper method that sets the image of the blow up card. This is the same as getting the Blow Up Card first of the UI by calling the getBlowUpCard() method, then settings its image via the setImage() method passing a relevant method call of the CardImageLoader of the OpportunityUI. Basically, this method is here to make your job easier.
        Parameters:
        image - is the image you want to load. Use the constants defined in CardImageLoader to select which image to load.

      • removeCardImageOfBlowUpCard

        public void removeCardImageOfBlowUpCard()
        This helper method removes the image of the blow up card. This method also automatically empties the blow up card.

      • getCardImageOfBlowUpCard

        public int getCardImageOfBlowUpCard()
        This is a helper method that gets the card image of the blow up card. This method will return one of the constant values defined in the CardImageLoader class; to use this method, you might want to check if the value returned by this card is equal to one of those constants, then react from there. For example: if (this.getOpportunityUI().getCardImageOfBlowUpCard() == CardImageLoader.NO_IMAGE) { this.getOpportunityUI().setCardImageOfBlowUpCard(CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL1); }
        Returns:
        the card image as a constant defined in the CardImageLoader class.

      • setMoneyOfPlayer

        public void setMoneyOfPlayer(int playerNum,
                    java.lang.String moneyAsString)
        This helper method sets the money of the player, given the player number and the money as String.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose money you want to change (1 or 2).
        moneyAsString - the amount of money of the player as a String.

      • setMoneyOfPlayer

        public void setMoneyOfPlayer(int playerNum,
                    double money)
        This helper method sets the money of the player, given the player number and the money as a double. Note that this method will NOT convert the double into money format (but will prepend the String "PHP" to it).
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose money you want to change (1 or 2).
        money - the amount of money of the player. This method will NOT convert the value of the money into money format.

      • setSpendingLimitOfPlayer

        public void setSpendingLimitOfPlayer(int playerNum,
                            java.lang.String moneyAsString)
        This helper method sets the spending limit of the player, given the player number and the money as String.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose money you want to change (1 or 2).
        moneyAsString - the amount of the spending limit of the player as a String.

      • setSpendingLimitOfPlayer

        public void setSpendingLimitOfPlayer(int playerNum,
                            double money)
        This helper method sets the spending limit of the player, given the player number and the money as a double. Note that this method will NOT convert the double into money format (but will prepend the String "Limit: " to it).
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose money you want to change (1 or 2).
        money - the amount of the spending limit of the player. This method will NOT convert the value of the money into money format.

      • setNameOfPlayer

        public void setNameOfPlayer(int playerNum,
                   java.lang.String name)
        This helper method sets the name of the player, given the player number and the new name. Note that this method will replace ALL the text contained within the label. If you wish to retain the "Player 1" or "Player 2" String, either prepend or append it to the name parameter you are passing to this method.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose name you want to change (1 or 2).
        name - is the new name of the player.

      • getNameOfPlayer

        public java.lang.String getNameOfPlayer(int playerNum)
        This helper method will get the name of the player that is currently being displayed on-screen. Note that this method will return ALL the contents of the player name label.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose name you want to get (1 or 2).
        Returns:
        the name of the player, given the playerNum

      • addCardToPlayerHand

        public void addCardToPlayerHand(int playerNum,
                       Card card)
        This method will add an instance of a card to the hand of the player.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player who will get the card (1 or 2).
        card - is the card that would be added to the selected player's hand.

      • addCardToPlayerHandWithImage

        public void addCardToPlayerHandWithImage(int playerNum,
                                int image)
        This method will create a new card instance and add it to the hand of the player. The image used for the card is based on the image parameter and the player whose hand the card will go to is based on the playerNum. Use the constants defined in the CardImageLoader as the image parameter to this method.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player who will get the card (1 or 2).
        image - the image of the newly generated card. Use the constants defined in the CardImageLoader class for this parameter.
        See Also:
        CardImageLoader

      • removeCardFromPlayerHand

        public void removeCardFromPlayerHand(int playerNum,
                            Card card)
        This method will remove the instance of the card passed as the second parameter to this method from the hand of the player whose player number matches the first parameter of this method.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose hand you want to remove a card from (1 or 2).
        card - is the card to be removed from the hand of the player.

      • removeCardFromPlayerHand

        public void removeCardFromPlayerHand(int playerNum,
                            int index)
        This method will remove a card from a player's hand, given the player number of the player and the index of the card from the player's hand. Note that the first card in the hand of the player is index 0.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the player number of the player whose hand you want to remove a card from (1 or 2).
        index - the index of the card you want to remove from the hand of the player.

      • getCurrentSelectedCard

        public Card getCurrentSelectedCard()
        Gets the card that is currently being blown up. This is useful if you want to transfer the card to another location on the board (for example, from the hand to the investments, or from the investment to the prime investment. This method would most likely be called in the ClickAction subclass that will be assigned to the buttons on the right side of the BlowUp Card.
        Returns:
        the card that is currently being blown up.

      • declareWinnerAndPlayAgain

        public boolean declareWinnerAndPlayAgain(int playerNum)
        This helper method declares a game winner through a confirmation dialog box, based on the specified integer parameter (which denotes the player number). This method returns true if the user clicked on "Yes" and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - is the number of the player that will be announced the winner (e.g. Player 1 wins so playerNum = 1)
        Returns:
        true if the user selected Yes, otherwise returns false

      • declareDrawAndPlayAgain

        public boolean declareDrawAndPlayAgain()
        This helper method declares the game a draw, then asks the players if they want to play again. This method returns true if the user clicked on "Yes" and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the user selected Yes, otherwise returns false

      • quitGame

        public void quitGame()
        This method will forcibly terminate the game.

      • getGameTable

        public GameTable getGameTable()
        Gets the GameTable of OpportunityUI. Do not use this method unless absolutely necessary.
        Returns:
        the GameTable of OpportunityUI.

      • setGameTable

        public void setGameTable(GameTable gameTable)
        Sets the GameTable of OpportunityUI. Do not use this method unless absolutely necessary.
        Parameters:
        gameTable - is the new GameTable that will replace the old GameTable of OpportunityUI.
